intro: Polyosma cambodiana, commonly known as Cambodian polyosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
